intro: Pleiocarpidia enneandra, commonly known as the nine-lobed pleiocarpidia, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its striking, palmately lobed leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It produces unique fruits that are follicles containing multiple seeds, a feature that contributes to its classification. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
